thread.title: WhatsApp stops working on these cell phones as of November 15
thread.title_full: WhatsApp stops working on these cell phones as of November 15

author: world today news
title: WhatsApp stops working on these cell phones as of November 15
text:
Affected Android models Many popular devices from brands such as Samsung, HTC, LG, Sony, Motorola, Nokia, Huawei and ZTE They will be left out of the WhatsApp compatibility list. Among them are older models that cannot update their operating system to higher versions of Android. Some of the most notable are:
Samsung : Galaxy S3, Galaxy Note II , Galaxy Ace 3, Galaxy S4 Mini. HTC : One X, One X+, Desire 500, Desire 601. LG : Optimus G, Nexus 4, G2 Mini, L90. Sony : Xperia Z, Xperia SP, Xperia T, Xperia V. Motorola : Moto G (1st generation), Droid Razr HD, Moto E (1st generation). Nokia : Lumia 920, Lumia 1020. Huawei : Ascend P6, Ascend Y300. ZTE : ZMAX, Grand X. These phones were launched with systems that, at the time, supported WhatsApp functions, but currently do not meet the requirements necessary for the new functionalities of the platform.
image.png
iPhones that will lose access to WhatsApp Regarding users of Apple the devices iPhone 5 y iPhone 5c will also be affected as their systems cannot be upgraded to iOS 12 the minimum version that WhatsApp will continue to support starting with this update.
How to know if your cell phone is compatible with the new version of WhatsApp It is possible to check if your phone’s operating system meets the minimum requirements of WhatsApp To continue using the app:
For Android devices
Open the application Configuration on the phone. Scroll and select About phone o Device information (depending on model). Find the option Software information o Android version . Here you can verify the installed version number. Untitled design (11).jpg
For iPhone devices
See the Configuration on the device. touch on General . Select Information and, in the section of Software version you will be able to see what version of iOS you have installed. If your device’s operating system is below the mentioned versions (Android 5.0 or iOS 12.0), unfortunately you will not be able to continue using WhatsApp on it after November 15, 2024.
Alternatives if WhatsApp stops working on your cell phone Update device Use WhatsApp Web Migrate to another messaging app Back up data Review system settings Contact technical support
